titlestmt.titleproper: Bryan Ehlinger Collection of Posters ARC.0118
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by James A. Kohler, Project Archivist

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-01-16T15:42-0500

did.abstract: The Bryan Ehlinger Collection of Posters consists of promotional posters used by record companies for advertising and in-store displays from 1978 to 1989 and 1994. Performers include David Bowie, Genesis, Jefferson Starship, Moody Blues, The Scorpions, and Trooper. The Collection provides a glimpse into how record companies promoted their artists and the records they released during the late 1970s and 1980s. Seen in a broader context, the Collection provides insight to the images and styles used to promote rock and roll music.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum, Inc. For more information, please consult the staff of the Library and Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Patrons must sign the Acknowledgment of Legal Responsibility and Privacy Rights statement on the Researcher Registration form before using this collection. Consult the Library and Archives in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Processed by James A. Kohler, Project Archivist. Completed June 29, 2011.
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS and local processing manual.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Bryan Ehlinger Collection of Posters is arranged alphabetically.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Bryan Elhinger is currently the Nursing Home Administrator of Oneida Healthcare Center's Extended Care Facility in Oneida, New York, where he has worked in various capacities since 1985. Ehlinger received a bachelor's degree in Healthcare Management from State University of New York Insititute of Technology at Utica / Rome in 2002.

list.head: Sources
list.item: "Bryan Ehlinger." Oneida Healthcare Center: Exceptional Care...Always. Last modified 2011. Accessed June 29, 2011. http://www.oneidahealthcare.org/news/index.cfm?action=view&newsitem_id=98.

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: The Bryan Ehlinger Collection of Posters was received by the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum, Inc. from Bryan Ehlinger on July 7, 2005.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Bryan Ehlinger Collection of Posters, Library and Archives, Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum.
